tool.name: beta significance
tool.description: This script runs any of a set of common tests to determine if a sample is statistically significantly different from another sample

param.label: -i/--input_path: input otu table in biom format
param.name: input_path

param.label: -s/--significance_test: significance test to use, options are 'unweighted_unifrac', 'weighted_unifrac', 'weighted_normalized_unifrac', or 'p-test'
param.name: significance_test

param.label: -k/--type_of_test: type of significance test to perform, options are 'all_together', 'each_pair' or 'each_sample'. [default: each_pair]
param.name: type_of_test

tool.help: The tests are conducted on each pair of samples present in the input otu table. See the unifrac tutorial online for more details (http://bmf2.colorado.edu/unifrac/tutorial.psp) The script outputs a tab delimited text file with each pair of samples and a p value representing the probability that a random sample/sequence assignment will result in more dissimilar samples than the actual pair of samples.
